intro: Siphocampylus boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species in the wild.
